Package gov.nasa.jpl.ammos.mpsa.aerie.merlinsdk.resources

Interface Solver<Resource,​Dynamics,​Condition>

  • Type Parameters:
    Resource - The topological space of resource values under discussion.
    Dynamics - The type of continuous time-dependent resource behaviors.
    Condition - The type of Boolean conditions on resource values.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiscreteSolver, PairedSolver, RealSolver
    public interface Solver<Resource,​Dynamics,​Condition>
    A solver over a continuous dynamics for a resource type and conditions against that resource.

    A dynamics is a continuous function from time (the real line) into a space of resource values (the resource type). A condition is a continuous function from the resource space into the space of boolean valuations, also called Sierpi≈Ñski space.

    A solver is able to perform two kinds of computations: solve a dynamics for its value at a time, and solve the composition of a dynamics and a condition -- in sum, a continuous function from time to truth values -- for the windows of time over which the condition is true.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default Optional<Duration> firstSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics, Condition condition, Window scope)
      Determine the first moment within a temporal scope in which a dynamics holds a condition true.
      Resource valueAt​(Dynamics dynamics, Duration elapsedTime)
      Determine the value of a resource under a dynamics at a given time.
      Windows whenSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics, Condition condition)
      Determine the windows of time over which a dynamics holds a condition true.
      default Windows whenSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics, Condition condition, Window scope)
      Determine the windows of time contained by a temporal scope over which a dynamics holds a condition true.

    • Method Detail

      • valueAt

        Resource valueAt​(Dynamics dynamics,
                 Duration elapsedTime)
        Determine the value of a resource under a dynamics at a given time.
        Parameters:
        dynamics - The dynamics governing the resource over time.
        elapsedTime - The time point at which to get a value.
        Returns:
        The resource value determined by the given dynamics at the given time.

      • whenSatisfied

        Windows whenSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics,
                      Condition condition)
        Determine the windows of time over which a dynamics holds a condition true.
        Parameters:
        dynamics - The dynamics governing the resource over time.
        condition - The condition assigning each resource value a truth value.
        Returns:
        The windows of time over which the condition is held true under the dynamics.

      • whenSatisfied

        default Windows whenSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics,
                              Condition condition,
                              Window scope)
        Determine the windows of time contained by a temporal scope over which a dynamics holds a condition true.

        This should be overridden if there is a more efficient way to compute windows within a scope than computing all windows and then intersecting with the scope.

        Parameters:
        dynamics - The dynamics governing the resource over time.
        condition - The condition assigning each resource value a truth value.
        scope - The temporal scope within which to look for windows.
        Returns:
        The windows of time over which the condition is held true under the dynamics within the temporal scope.

      • firstSatisfied

        default Optional<Duration> firstSatisfied​(Dynamics dynamics,
                                          Condition condition,
                                          Window scope)
        Determine the first moment within a temporal scope in which a dynamics holds a condition true.

        This should be overridden if there is a more efficient way to determine the first satisfying instant than producing a complete list of windows.

        Parameters:
        dynamics - The dynamics governing the resource over time.
        condition - The condition assigning each resource value a truth value.
        scope - The temporal scope within which to look for a satisfying instant.
        Returns:
        The first instant on which the condition is true, or an empty Optional if the condition is never true.
